meanings.definition: A person or machine that mangles or destroys something.
meanings.sent1: The old mangle in the laundry room was used to press clothes.
meanings.sent2: The mangle at the factory was broken and needed repair.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy mangle operator accidentally tore the fabric.
meanings.sent4: The mangle of destruction left a trail of ruined items.
meanings.sent5: The fierce mangle of the machine was heard throughout the building.

meanings.definition: To severely damage or mutilate something.
meanings.sent1: Please be careful not to mangle the delicate paper.
meanings.sent2: The car accident mangled the front bumper beyond repair.
meanings.sent3: He managed to mangle his sandwich while trying to cut it.
meanings.sent4: The storm mangled the trees, leaving a path of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The fierce winds mangled the flag, making it unrecognizable.

meanings.sent1: She tends to mangle the dough when making bread.
meanings.sent2: The new employee mangled the files while organizing them.
meanings.sent3: He always manages to mangle his words when nervous.
meanings.sent4: The toddler mangled the puzzle pieces, unable to fit them together.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic mangled the engine part, causing more damage.
